metadata.description: Google Groups can be left misconfigured and leak sensitive company data if access permissions aren't properly set
reproductionSteps: Follow the steps in the references

metadata.serviceName: Google CloudStorage Bucket Misconfigured Read Permissions
metadata.description: GCP Storage Bucket can be left misconfigured and allow anyone to access files and objects potentially containing sensitive data if access permissions aren't properly enforced
reproductionSteps: Observe the response for any disclosed information (like private files). View the references for more information.

detectionFingerprints: This is not supported in the current configuration.

metadata.description: In case signups are not turned off, any user can create an account on the Jenkins instance and gain (privileged) access to (internal) developer resources.
reproductionSteps: Observe the response and follow the steps to create an account. View the references for more information.

metadata.description: Groovy Script Console provides developers a way to run Groovy Script code right from their browser. However, in case permissions aren't configured properly, it could introduce another attack vector and often lead to remote code execution.
reproductionSteps: Observe the response and follow the steps to check for code execution. View the references for more information.

detectionFingerprints: Discover projects, groups and snippets. Share your projects with others

metadata.serviceName: Gitlab Private Source Code Snippets Exposed
metadata.description: Your GitLab instance may expose sensitive source code or private repositories if read permissions on Project Snippets have been misconfigured.
reproductionSteps: Observe the response and follow the steps to check public snippets. View the references for more information.

metadata.serviceName: Drupal Nodes with Misconfigured Access Controls
metadata.description: Drupal Nodes can contain sensitive data and if permissions are not enforced, they can leak private data to unauthorized users.
reproductionSteps: Observe the response and follow the steps to check public snippets. View the references for more information.

metadata.description: Laravel can expose sensitive data when debug mode is left enabled.
reproductionSteps: Observe the response manually and check if debug mode is enabled on your target's Laravel application. View the references for more information.

metadata.description: Telescope can help developers look at incoming HTTP requests, view exceptions, logs, database queries and much more.
reproductionSteps: Observe the response manually and check if Telescope is installed and used in your target's Laravel application. View the references for more information.

fingerprints: The __Directive type represents a Directive that a server supports.

metadata.description: The introspection query returns a GraphQL schema with all the information about the GraphQL API, including what queries it supports like schemas, mutations, fields, but also in some cases, private fields.
reproductionSteps: Observe the response manually and check if GraphQL returned back the entire schema with all the information. View the references for more information.
